intro: Jambosa venosa, commonly known as the veined jambosa, is a tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, velvety leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are large, fleshy berries that contain numerous seeds. Jambosa venosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
